intro: Collaea neesii, commonly known as the narrow-leafed rock heath, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, narrow leaves and clusters of white to pale pink flowers. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils in coastal or mountainous regions. Collaea neesii is often found in open habitats and is adapted to withstand coastal conditions.
